text.text:
I paid ₹9,000 for two nights, and choosing this hotel was the worst decision of my life. First, their team lacks coordination—one staff member agreed to an early check-in, while another denied it. Then, they asked us to compromise on the AC, which wasn’t working, and offered a table fan instead. Is this what we paid ₹9,000 for?

The room was not ready even after a five-hour wait. The shower tap, TV, and room controller were all non-functional, and when we called for assistance, the response was extremely delayed. Basic amenities like plates were not provided, which should be standard in any hotel room.

When we requested a room change because the AC wasn’t cooling, the receptionist completely ignored our request. I would not recommend anyone to waste their money on such a terrible hotel.

editorialSummary.text: Unassuming property offering free breakfast & a restaurant, as well as meeting space.

text.text:
We initially planned to stay here for just one night but ended up extending it to three — which says a lot about the experience! It’s a 3-star property, and I’d recommend booking online since the walk-in (offline) rates are quite expensive. Booking online cost us around ₹2800 for two people per day, whereas booking offline was about ₹3300 for a standard room.

The room was well-equipped with all the basic amenities you'd expect — comfortable bed, good lighting, a TV, and a working desk. It was clean, cozy, and maintained well during our stay.

The washroom, while clean and functional, felt a bit old. Some fixtures like the glass partition in the shower area were damaged, and a few fittings showed signs of wear and tear. Nothing majorly inconvenient, but it’s an area where the hotel could definitely improve with some renovation.

Despite that, the service was top-notch. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. There’s also a small gym available, which was a pleasant surprise.

The best part? The location. The hotel sits on a vibrant street lined with branded stores and popular cafes — everything is within walking distance.

Overall, a pleasant experience with great service and an unbeatable location. Just be sure to book online for the best deal!

text.text: Stayed at La Sara Home Hotel, Bangalore. While the overall stay was good, check-in wasn’t smooth despite pre-booking — I had to wait for 1.5 hours due to a maintenance issue. Also, the Wi-Fi wasn’t reliable during my 48-hour stay, which made work a bit difficult. But apart from that, the location is excellent — everything you need is just outside. Rooms were clean, spacious, and well-maintained. The staff, especially Mr. Akash, was very polite and helpful. Their in-house restaurant, Nandana Palace, serves amazing food — breakfast and dinner were both delicious. They do take good care of their guests. If they can improve time management for check-ins and fix the Wi-Fi connectivity, it would be a perfect experience. Recommended for its comfort, location, and hospitality.

Exceptional Customer Service at [Quality comfort]

During my recent stay at [Quality comfort,] I was thoroughly impressed by the outstanding customer care provided by the staff. From the moment I arrived, the front desk team greeted me warmly, making the check-in process swift and pleasant. They were attentive to my needs and ensured that all my questions were answered with patience and professionalism.

What stood out the most was the staff's proactive approach to service. They anticipated my needs, offering assistance before I even had to ask. For instance, when I inquired about local dining options, they not only provided a list of nearby restaurants but also offered personal recommendations based on my preferences.

The housekeeping team maintained the room impeccably, and any requests for additional amenities were met promptly. Their commitment to cleanliness and guest comfort was evident throughout my stay.

Overall, the exceptional customer service at [Quality comfort,] made my stay memorable and enjoyable. I highly recommend this motel to anyone seeking a comfortable stay with top-notch hospitality.

text.text:
On Holiday travel with Family….We booked rooms on our last moment. Rooms are good .
***Breakfast is pathetic… we wanted only rooms without breakfast but they only have  rooms with breakfast only… only .  We were travelling and had no time to look for other hotel.
* 8th floor where breakfast is served is literally dirty around to look .
* Towels are very dirty. Looked like they were used from 3-4 years. Though we used our towel.
** we had extra mattress on requirement. The mattress was worn out dirty and the material inside the mattress was hurting though it was covered with bed sheet. Upon asking the room boy replied I DID NOT MAKE IT.. it was at 1 am so was tired and couldn’t call the receptionist…. Should have given good mattress in first place.
** we were given two single beds knowing tht we r family… we have to change it after some time.
*  Bathroom is okay. Buckets are old.
The floor which I stayed was full of cigarette smoke… although my room is closed smoke enters. Trouble for breathing..In my opposite room and adjacent room people were smoking.. Definitely no for next time.

text.text: Porch Inn Hotel was a perfect home stay to settle down for total of 4 days altogether. The room allotted was quite decent, well equipped with lights and efficient AC and fan running, good cosy bed with other necessary furniture. Good hot water facility, drinking water was not an issue, clean and hygienic washroom with necessary toiletries provided. Daily housekeeping was done and necessary tea/coffee sachets, new soaps, moisturizer and shampoo was provided. Change of towels if requested, maintaining clean and comfy beds were all done as part of their duties. Felt great with the exceptional services, staff on duty were very polite and courteous. Any queries were resolved in a friendly manner and promptly attended. Breakfast once ordered during our stay was also nice. Made up my mind that whenever I visit Bangalore, this is the only place to enjoy and stay...

text.text:
I booked a standard room at The Porch Inn Hotel , After the smooth check-in , helpful staff behaviour decided to extend my stay for a week However, I left after one night due to a disappointing experience. The room was small compared to other hotels, with basic amenities (soap, shampoo, towels, water) but no dental kit . The lack of an in-house restaurant was inconvenient; a digital scanner offered a limited menu, and dining in the small room was impractical. Breakfast was below average, with insufficient chutney and sambar, and the ordering process felt cumbersome.
Most staff were polite, but the night receptionist was extremely rude and unprofessional, making me feel unsafe. This was the main reason I vacated early. The basement parking is small and congested but I found no problem as the staff helps with parking your vehicle.Other room types (1-2 BHK) might be better, but I didn’t try them.
The Porch Inn is okay for a budget stay near NIMHANS, but the small rooms ( I wasn’t able to work as there is no proper space in room for desk or chairs), and the night receptionist’s behavior make it hard to recommend. Other hotels in the area offer better comfort. I hope management addresses the staff issue.

text.text:
My recent stay at this hotel was far from satisfactory. The staff behavior was extremely disappointing; they were rude and unaccommodating, which made the entire experience unpleasant. The room was much smaller than expected, especially considering the high pricing. To make matters worse, the cleanliness was subpar – the room and bathroom were not properly maintained, which is unacceptable for a hotel at this price point.

Overall, I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone. The combination of poor service, lack of cleanliness, and unreasonable pricing makes it a poor choice for travelers. I hope the management takes these issues seriously and improves their standards.

text.text:
The room was extremely small and not worth the price. The staff were rude and arrogant, acting as if they were working at NASA with their attitude.

At check-in, we informed the reception that one of our cars would be parked in their parking lot, and they agreed. We parked our car and went on a short trip. However, when we returned the next morning, they suddenly started demanding ₹500 per day for parking. Had we known this earlier, we would have parked at the airport, which is much cheaper.

This place is purely money-minded and definitely not worth paying over ₹1000 for a room. Charging ₹500 per day for parking when we had already gotten prior approval is unreasonable. I wouldn’t recommend staying here.

text.text:
I was assigned a room directly opposite the service lobby, which remains open at night and causes consistent noise past midnight. This severely disrupted my sleep and led to headaches and immense discomfort.

Adding to the ordeal, today at 2 PM, when I tried to get some daytime rest, I was again disturbed this time by construction noises from renovation work in the property. Astonishingly, only after this disturbance was a room change even considered basic rest should be a given, not something guests must fight for.

It's basic courtesy for a brand like Marriott to disclose ongoing renovations on their website so guests like me can make an informed choice. The absence of this transparency is deeply disappointing.

Overall, a pathetic experience. The only reason this review isn’t a zero-star rating is due to the housekeeping staff and some other staff, who were courteous and professional.

text.text:
We hosted a birthday event for our 1 year old son. The experience with Kandi Tree staff was very good. The food was lip smacking and delicious. The hall can accommodate max 150 guests. We were very happy with the staff and manager Mr. Sebastin. His attitude towards us was very good.

At any event, food should be given no. 1 importance and we felt that catering staff delivered it well. We were not at all disappointed.

The complimentary room given to us was neat, tidy and spacious!

Only problem was car parking. There is very little car parking space for us and guests. Thats why one star less.

Hall decoration was amazingly done by Mr. Veeresh. Hall was looking very pretty which made our function even more special.

Before booking the hall, we came and tried varieties of food from their menu. They have a dedicated restaurant called “Clove”. The food here is also very very delicious and tasty. Very underrated restaurant at Jayanagar 4th block.

From now on, we will continue to visit the restaurant whenever we crave for non-veg.

text.text:
She is the Taj! This is their motto and vision. And they truly live upto their legacy. Deep rooted in tradition and culture of Indian hospitality, the Taj MG road BLR is an epitome of the same.

My family and I spent 6 nights at this exemplary masterpiece of a hotel and I must say it has been the most memorable of my experiences so far. The staff from the doorman to the restaurant to the front desk and the housekeeping, each one contributing to give their customers the most wonderful experience which truly resonates what the Taj stands for.

text.text:
I recently stayed at the Taj MG for 3 days and had a mixed experience that I feel compelled to share.
The Positives:
The hotel's accommodation standards are excellent, and the staff are genuinely warm and welcoming in their greetings. You can tell they want to provide good service, and the property maintains the luxury feel you'd expect from the Taj brand.
The Issues:
Unfortunately, while the staff excel at pleasantries, they seem to struggle with proper room preparation and issue resolution. Upon arrival, our room had empty shower gel dispensers and a non-functioning TV - basic amenities that should have been checked before handing over the room to guests, especially given the hotel's star rating.
While the shower gel issue was resolved immediately when I mentioned it, it shouldn't have been an issue in the first place. A hotel of this caliber should have proper housekeeping checks to ensure rooms are guest-ready.
More concerning was the TV problem. Despite raising this with multiple staff members throughout my 3-day stay and receiving repeated assurances that it would be "looked into," the issue was never resolved. It's baffling how a premier property can fail to address such a straightforward maintenance issue.
Bottom Line:
For a property that positions itself as premium hospitality, basic room preparation oversights and inability to handle guest requests are unacceptable. While the physical property and staff demeanor are pleasant, the attention to detail and follow-through need serious improvement.
I expected much better from such an established hotel group.

text.text:
Our one-night stay at Taj MG Road was nothing short of magical. From the moment we arrived, we felt enveloped in luxury. The warm welcome, elegant interiors, and impeccable service made us feel truly royal.

The room was beautifully designed with a perfect blend of classic charm and modern comfort – ideal for a romantic escape. Every detail, from the soft linens to the ambient lighting, created a serene and intimate atmosphere.

Dining at the hotel was a fine experience in itself. The culinary offerings were exceptional – rich in flavor and beautifully presented. It felt like a royal feast with every course.

Overall, our stay was a perfect mix of luxury, romance, and top-tier hospitality. Taj MG made our getaway truly unforgettable, and we can't wait to return.

text.text:
Location is the highlight.. all locations at MG road, brigade, residency are easily accessible from On Time which helps you to be on time at any place in the heart of Bangalore.
Rooms are small but has all amenities - it's fine, considering the prime location that the place is.
The staff, service is excellent and they might be over doing a bit.

I asked for an iron box, went out for a stroll.. the room service just barged in with the master key and kept it in cupboard.. I was not informed.. I ended up waiting the rest of the day .. when finally before retiring for the day, decided to alert room service that iron box was not provided, only to hear that it was already kept inside.. I was a bit surprised as I was not expecting anyone to access my room.. the next day after breakfast while I was trying to iron my clothes couldn't locate the iron.. I was surprised and annoyed as again I was informed that the room service has taken the liberty to take if off as they believed in my promptness in attending to my ironing matters the yesternight and duly took the iron to another room!! I then had to wait till the room service took their sweet time to get me another one ... Heights of efficiency.. but at the cost of customers trust!

text.text:
Excellent Stay at The OnTime Hotel, Ashok Nagar, Bangalore

I had a wonderful experience staying at The OnTime Hotel in Ashok Nagar, Bangalore. The hotel's location is truly unbeatable — situated in the heart of the city with easy access to MG Road, the metro, and other key areas, making it incredibly convenient for both business and leisure travelers.

The staff at the hotel are exceptionally welcoming, cooperative, and always ready to assist with a humble attitude. Their warmth and professionalism made my stay even more enjoyable.

The food served at the hotel is simply superb — delicious, fresh, and satisfying. The hygiene standards maintained across the hotel, including the common areas, rooms, and restaurants, are top-notch and truly commendable.

Whether you're visiting for business, family, friends, or solo, this hotel caters to all needs comfortably. It is undoubtedly one of the best options within a 10 km radius of MG Road and Ashok Nagar.

My heartfelt congratulations to the management and staff for maintaining such high standards. Keep up the excellent work, and I look forward to staying here again!

text.text:
The Lalit Ashok Bengaluru is a 5-star hotel located in the heart of Bangalore, India. It is a luxurious hotel that is perfect for business and leisure travelers alike. The hotel has a variety of amenities, including a swimming pool, spa, fitness center, and several restaurants. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is also located close to many of Bangalore's attractions, making it a great place to stay if you want to explore the city.

Pros:

Luxurious accommodations

Friendly and helpful staff

Convenient location

Variety of amenities

Excellent service

Cons:

Some guests have found the hotel to be noisy

The hotel is a bit on the expensive side

Overall, I highly recommend The Lalit Ashok Bengaluru to anyone looking for a luxurious and convenient hotel in Bangalore.

Here are some specific details about my stay at The Lalit Ashok Bengaluru:

Check-in:

Check-in was quick and easy. The staff was friendly and helpful and made me feel welcome.

Room:

I stayed in a Premier Double Room with Pool View. The room was spacious and well-appointed. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was clean and spacious. I also enjoyed the view of the pool from my balcony.

Amenities:

The hotel has a variety of amenities, including a swimming pool, spa, fitness center, and several restaurants. I used the swimming pool and spa, and both were excellent. The spa is especially nice, and I recommend getting a massage if you have time.

Dining:

I ate at the hotel's restaurant, The Market Place, for breakfast. The breakfast buffet was excellent, and there was a wide variety of food to choose from. I also had dinner at the hotel's restaurant, The Belvedere. The food was delicious, and the service was excellent.

Service:

The staff at The Lalit Ashok Bengaluru is friendly and helpful. They were always willing to go the extra mile to make my stay comfortable.

Location:

The hotel is located in the heart of Bangalore, close to many of the city's attractions. I was able to walk to many of the places I wanted to visit, which was a big plus.

Overall, I had a great stay at The Lalit Ashok Bengaluru. The hotel is luxurious, convenient, and has excellent service. I would definitely stay here again if I am ever in Bangalore.

I hope this review is helpful. If you have any questions, please feel free to ask.

text.text:
From the very beginning of our two-day journey at Hotel Le Grandeur in the heart of Bangalore, my family and I were enveloped in an ambiance of warmth and sophistication that made our stay utterly memorable.

The edifice boasts of an impeccable cleanliness that is not just confined to the aesthetic appeal but also extends to providing a safe and hygienic environment for all guests, including families with young children. Every nook and corner of the hotel sparkled with meticulous attention to detail, rendering the space bright and inviting. This attention to detail made us, as a family, feel comfortable and at ease during our entire stay.

Service is the cornerstone of Hotel Le Grandeur, and this was evident through the dedicated and professional staff that graced the establishment. Each member of the team showcased a high level of commitment to ensuring that our needs were not just met, but exceeded. From the front desk to housekeeping, service was swift, efficient, and executed with a smile.

Special commendation is due for Manager Shrinivas, whose leadership and personal involvement in the hotel’s operations were palpable. Mr. Shrinivas embodies the essence of true hospitality, being attentive and considerate to guests while overseeing a seamless and delightful hotel experience for all. Under his stewardship, the staff at Le Grandeur function as a harmonious unit dedicated to providing unparalleled service.

In addition to the outstanding staff, the services and amenities available at the hotel contributed significantly to the delightful atmosphere. Engaging areas for children to play and explore were coupled with tranquil spaces for adults to relax and unwind. This thoughtful arrangement made the hotel a suitable choice for families like ours, ensuring that guests of all ages could enjoy their time at Le Grandeur to the fullest.

In conclusion, our stay at Hotel Le Grandeur in Bangalore was nothing short of spectacular. It is a haven where service, cleanliness, and comfort converge to offer guests a truly grand experience. Our heartfelt gratitude goes out to Manager Shrinivas and the entire team for making our short but sweet stay deeply enjoyable and absolutely unforgettable. We eagerly anticipate our next visit and would highly recommend Hotel Le Grandeur to other discerning travelers seeking a blend of luxury and warmth in the vibrant city of Bangalore.

text.text:
The rooms are shabby and show a lack of maintenance. For instance, chest of drawers in the room have handles missing and sharp edges. The windows are single glazed and let in cold air and noise from outside. There is a kettle and fridge in the room, but neither of them worked.
The bathroom had lovely and very striking black and white marble around the sink, but the grouting around the tiling in the rest of the room was grubby. The shower head was suspended above a semi-sunken small bath, when modern showers are in a separate shower cubicle, some with rain-water heads.
There was no hot water.
There were lots of room fresheners hanging all over the bedrooms and corridors. We counted 4 in our bedroom alone. It did make us wonder how awful the rooms would have smelled, without them.
Staff at Reception were extremely unhelpful. We were a party of 6 couples, celebrating a wedding reception in the hotel. We had booked 6 rooms, of which 2 were day rooms, for the bride and other women in the party to use for getting ready. Reception staff seemed to be unable to find all our rooms, especially the day rooms, which just led to extra stress for the wedding party. When the Reception staff finally managed to find the rooms we had booked, they threw a pen and the form across the counter, with a cursory “fill this in”. No “please”.
The entrance to the hotel is stunning, with lots of white marble, and very attractive glass lifts up to the upper floors of the hotel. However, there appeared to be no staircase alongside the lifts, which is unbelievably dangerous in case of fire, and annoying in case of a power cut (of which there were two or three short-lived occurrences during our overnight stay).
The interior décor gave rise to a certain amount of dark humour, as the corridors had a certain fin-de-siécle cruise liner vibe. With Céline Dior’s rendition of “My heart will go on” on a permanent loop on the hotel’s sound system, we felt like we were in the last days of the Titanic.

The swimming pool was closed because of Covid/maintenance. Which was it? There’s no sense in it being closed because of Covid. Why not just say it’s closed for maintenance?

Why have I given this hotel 2 stars? Because the food served up at the wedding reception was excellent. The room that the party took place in was spacious and beautifully decorated.

This hotel has a lot to learn if it’s hoping to attract customers who expect the best.

text.text:
I recently took the IELTS test at Capitol Hotel in Bengaluru, and I must say it was a fantastic experience overall. The hotel served as the test center for my Reading, Writing, and Listening tests, and I couldn't be happier with the facilities and services provided. First and foremost, the staff at Capitol Hotel were incredibly welcoming and professional. From the moment I arrived at the test center, they made sure that all the necessary arrangements were in place and that the testing environment was conducive to focus and concentration. The registration process was smooth, and they were very helpful in answering any last-minute queries I had.
The testing rooms were spacious and well-lit, creating a comfortable atmosphere to take the exams. The chairs and desks were comfortable, ensuring that I didn't face any discomfort during the long duration of the tests. The hotel's quiet ambiance was perfect for the Listening section, and I could concentrate without any distractions. The technical setup for the Listening test was flawless, with high-quality audio equipment that ensured clarity in the recordings. Likewise, for the Writing test, they provided us with all the necessary materials, including answer sheets, stationary items and pens, leaving no room for stress or worries. Another aspect worth mentioning is the location of the hotel. It was conveniently located, making it easy for candidates like me to find the place without any trouble. Moreover, there were ample parking spaces available, which was a great relief for those who commuted by car. The test administrators were also very professional and strictly adhered to the official guidelines, ensuring a fair and transparent testing process for everyone. I appreciated their attention to detail and how they managed the test sessions efficiently.

text.text:
Absolutely horrid experience. As a foreign traveller, some of the basic amenities we would expect to access are free wi-fi, a breakfast service (inclusive) and a hotel room that you feel  is safe and functional.

Felt like a bit of a prison with no access to TV, no wi-fi, with the rundown state of the rooms - it was just one of the worst things I’ve ever put money towards.

I was duped into thinking this was a 4-star hotel. Hotels are meant to provide a safe haven for travellers. I was not able to communicate with people adequately within the hotel and even a taxi service was so ridiculously hard to book with them (the receptionist stated they were not a taxi service). As a foreigner, a 4-star hotel to me would include a buffet service for breakfast included. Wi-fi in this day and time is absolutely essential and a taxi/travelling service that is trusted to ensure we as travellers can safely travel to and from the hotel is the very least I would expect!!!

Instead, as a group we had to run outside of the hotel and beg on the street for some rickshaws/taxis to flag them down - no idea what a good rate would have been as we were desperate.

No access to food in the morning/afternoon/nights meant we had to figure out the streets of Bangalore with no wi-fi in our rooms to have a plan of where to go or what was helpful.

Furthermore, the state of the rooms (though we were put into royal suites) was so pathetic and run-down.

What a shame that I spent my money here. They weren’t even able to offer us much to keep us happy. We were stuck here as we were helpless. My experience of this hotel is of desperation and isolation. Absolutely unfit for travellers and should not have the label of a ‘hotel’ as it does not keep travellers safe and comfortable.

I was not able to communicate with people adequately within the hotel and even a taxi service was so ridiculously hard to book with them (the receptionist stated they were not a taxi service). As a foreigner, a 4-star hotel to me would include a buffet service for breakfast included. Wi-fi in this day and time is absolutely essential and a taxi/travelling service that is trusted to ensure we as travellers can safely travel to and from the hotel is the very least I would expect!!!

Instead, as a group we had to run outside of the hotel and beg on the street for some rickshaws/taxis to flag them down - no idea what a good rate would have been as we were desperate.

No access to food in the morning/afternoon/nights meant we had to figure out the streets of Bangalore with no wi-fi in our rooms to have a plan of where to go or what was helpful.

Furthermore, the state of the rooms (though we were put into royal suites) was so pathetic and run-down.

What a shame that I spent my money here. They weren’t even able to offer us much to keep us happy. We were stuck here as we were helpless. My experience of this hotel is of desperation and isolation. Absolutely unfit for travellers and should not have the label of a ‘hotel’ as it does not keep travellers safe and comfortable.

text.text:
recently stayed at Lasara hometel for a 10 day getaway, and it exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I arrived, the staff were welcoming, professional, and incredibly helpful. Check-in was quick and smooth.

The room was spotlessly clean, modern, and spacious, with a very comfortable bed and quality linens. I particularly appreciated the thoughtful amenities like a coffee maker, complimentary bottled water, and fast, free Wi-Fi. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job maintaining the room throughout my stay.

One of the highlights was the breakfast buffet: fresh, varied, and beautifully presented. They offered everything from hot items to fresh fruits, pastries, and made-to-order eggs. The dining area was clean and well-staffed, with a lovely ambiance.

Overall, I had a fantastic stay at La Sara and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for comfort, convenience, and excellent service. I’ll definitely be back!

text.text:
We initially planned to stay here for just one night but ended up extending it to three — which says a lot about the experience! It’s a 3-star property, and I’d recommend booking online since the walk-in (offline) rates are quite expensive. Booking online cost us around ₹2800 for two people per day, whereas booking offline was about ₹3300 for a standard room.

The room was well-equipped with all the basic amenities you'd expect — comfortable bed, good lighting, a TV, and a working desk. It was clean, cozy, and maintained well during our stay.

The washroom, while clean and functional, felt a bit old. Some fixtures like the glass partition in the shower area were damaged, and a few fittings showed signs of wear and tear. Nothing majorly inconvenient, but it’s an area where the hotel could definitely improve with some renovation.

Despite that, the service was top-notch. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. There’s also a small gym available, which was a pleasant surprise.

The best part? The location. The hotel sits on a vibrant street lined with branded stores and popular cafes — everything is within walking distance.

Overall, a pleasant experience with great service and an unbeatable location. Just be sure to book online for the best deal!

text.text:
Hello Review seekers

I have stayed here for almost 9 days. I want to personally thank Mr Rajesh for being very prompt with my requests. Reviewing the Hotel across few parameters:

(1) Location - Centrally located near Shanti Nagar. It has close proximity to Richmond/Cubbon park/Koramangala/Indiranagar. All of this places are less than 10 kms / ~30 - 35 mins from the hotel. It's opposite Shanti Nagar bus terminus ( ~ 5 mins walking)

(2) Room - Very spacious rooms, with a good buffer area to keep your luggage & move around. Washroom has basic shower, big wash basin & overall it's decent in size. There is lot of headroom to make it better by deploying hooks on the back of the door or basic fixtures to hang your clothes. Basic toiletries provided.

(3) Cleanliness - The room was clean daily and basic hygiene was ensured. No cockroaches or bed bugs in the room.

(4) No in-house restaurant - They don't have an in-house restaurant so one has to either order / go out. Mr Rajesh provided morning tea as a complimentary. He accomodated this on request.

(5) Price - I was given the bottom rate tariff, which was very reasonable & a fair amount to pay.

Overall had a pleasant stay. Highly recommended for business trips/ solo travellers looking for affordable options.

text.text:
The Porch Inn is a comfortable and decently located hotel that offers good value. The rooms are spacious, clean, and equipped with good lighting, powerful hot showers, and efficient AC and fans. The staff was attentive, and breakfast was tasty with decent options. The location is ideal for exploring Lalbagh Botanical Garden and Wilson Garden.

However, it can be very noisy due to its location near a main road, and the lack of a lounge area makes it less appealing for a long stay. Due to the noise pollution we wouldn't want to stay longer than two nights, and hard to fully unwind with a busy road outside. And there are no windows to open for fresh air. Wifi was also quite poor speed. If you're in Bangalore for a few nights and value cleanliness and convenience, Port Inn is a solid choice.

text.text:
Just okay stay at Justa, Indiranagar - Great Location, Lacks Polish

This hotel had the potential to be a good stay, but it fell short of expectations. While the location is fantastic - quiet just behind the main road with easy access to cabs and a variety of restaurants and shops nearby - the overall experience felt closer to a 3-star hotel than the advertised 4-star rating.

The rooms themselves are spacious and a good size for the price. However, a refresh is sorely needed. The furniture and decor felt dated, and the bathroom, while clean, had a slightly shabby feel.  Unfortunately, the room window lock was broken, and it took three requests to room service before they were able to provide a temporary fix.

Room service itself was otherwise good, but the air conditioning was another point of disappointment. Even with the thermostat set to a chilly 16 degrees, the airflow was minimal, making the room uncomfortably warm at times.

The complimentary breakfast was another area lacking. Options were very limited, and service was slow. It felt like you had to specifically request items to be brought out, rather than having a buffet or readily available selections.

Overall, this hotel is a decent option for budget-minded travelers who prioritize location and convenience over luxurious amenities. However, those expecting a true 4-star experience may be disappointed.

Exceptional Hospitality and Comfort

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Renaissance Hotel for a business trip, and I must say, it exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I checked in, the staff made me feel incredibly welcome and valued.

The hospitality was truly exceptional, with every staff member displaying warmth and eagerness to assist. The food was outstanding, with a diverse range of options to suit every taste. The breakfast spread, in particular, was impressive and delicious.

One staff member who deserves special mention is Sarupa, who went above and beyond to make my stay truly special. Her attention to detail, kindness, and genuine interest in ensuring my comfort made a significant impact on my overall experience.

The hotel's amenities and services were top-notch, making it an ideal choice for business travelers. I would highly recommend Renaissance Hotel to anyone seeking exceptional hospitality, comfort, and value.

Rating: 5/5 stars

•⁠  ⁠Exceptional staff hospitality
•⁠  ⁠Delicious food and breakfast options
•⁠  ⁠Comfortable and clean accommodations
•⁠  ⁠Outstanding service from Sarupa

Will I return? Absolutely!

text.text:
I recently celebrated my wife's birthday at the Renaissance Bengaluru, and our experience was mostly positive, with a few areas of concern. The room provided was well-appointed and comfortable, and the hotel staff had thoughtfully decorated it to enhance our celebration, which was greatly appreciated. The complimentary wine and cake were delightful touches that added to the joy of the occasion.

The overall service was adequate, though not exceptional. The food at the hotel's dining facilities was decent, meeting our expectations without exceeding them. However, I would like to address a slight inconsistency we encountered regarding the customer service. Upon booking over the phone, the duty manager was initially very accommodating about a special request we had. Unfortunately, upon our arrival, there seemed to be a noticeable shift in her demeanor once it became apparent that we were not among the more high-end clientele. This subtle change was a bit disheartening and suggested a preferential policy that could be off-putting to guests expecting consistent treatment.

While we enjoyed our stay and the special efforts made for the birthday celebration, the experience highlighted an area where the hospitality could be more inclusive, ensuring that all guests receive equal treatment regardless of their perceived status. Despite this, we had a memorable stay, and I would recommend the hotel to those planning a special occasion, with the hope that the service becomes more uniformly gracious.

text.text:
We hosted a birthday event for our 1 year old son. The experience with Kandi Tree staff was very good. The food was lip smacking and delicious. The hall can accommodate max 150 guests. We were very happy with the staff and manager Mr. Sebastin. His attitude towards us was very good.

At any event, food should be given no. 1 importance and we felt that catering staff delivered it well. We were not at all disappointed.

The complimentary room given to us was neat, tidy and spacious!

Only problem was car parking. There is very little car parking space for us and guests. Thats why one star less.

Hall decoration was amazingly done by Mr. Veeresh. Hall was looking very pretty which made our function even more special.

Before booking the hall, we came and tried varieties of food from their menu. They have a dedicated restaurant called “Clove”. The food here is also very very delicious and tasty. Very underrated restaurant at Jayanagar 4th block.

From now on, we will continue to visit the restaurant whenever we crave for non-veg.
